snippet: The new fighting was reported as diplomatic recriminations intensified over the resignation of Kofi Annan, the special peace envoy.
abstract: Deadly attack on Palestinian refugee camp in Syria, in which at least 20 people are killed, may push Palestinians to shift their allegiance from Pres Bashar al-Assad to the rebel camp even though it is not clear which group was responsible for attack.

byline.original: By DAMIEN CAVE and DALAL MAWAD
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Aleppo, Syria.

lead_paragraph: The new fighting was reported as diplomatic recriminations intensified over the resignation of Kofi Annan, the special peace envoy.

headline.seo: New Fighting Reported in Syria, Including Deadly Assault on Palestinian Camp
headline.main: Deadly Attack on Refugee Camp in Syria Could Shift Palestinian Allegiances to Rebels
headline.print_headline: Deadly Attack on Refugee Camp in Syria Could Shift Palestinian Allegiances to Rebels

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
